#Text=Canada 's Parkdale — High Park ( Ward 13 ) city council candidates speak
#Text=Monday , October 30 , 2006
#Text=On November 13 , Torontoians will be heading to the polls to vote for their ward 's councillor and for mayor .
#Text=Among Toronto 's ridings is Parkdale — High Park ( Ward 13 ) .
#Text=Two candidates responded to Wikinews ' requests for an interview .
#Text=This ward 's candidates include Linda Coltman , David Garrick , Greg Hamara , Aleksander Oniszczak , Bill Saundercook ( incumbent ) , and Frances Wdowczyk .
#Text=For more information on the election , read Toronto municipal election , 2006 .
#Text=Linda Coltman
#Text=35-year-old Linda Coltman is a consultant and boards member .
#Text=Q : Describe the three most important issues in your campaign .
#Text=A :

#Text=Voter specific engagement ( locally ) leading to the new implementation of something citizen driven on an annual , in ward basis ( & an increased citizenry interest in voting and voter engagement in general ) .
#Text=Identifying the social needs of our wards residents and seeking recommendations to such and working towards great new adventurous ways of addressing same .

#Text=Being open to inviting corporate development within our ward through the recognition of our strong cultural heritage and respect of such through a means of encouraging positive address of the social needs of the ward 13 constituency .
#Text=Q : What one election issue do you feel is most relevant to your ward in this election ?

#Text=A : Unifying the ward and increasing civic engagement throughout ( increased participation , heightened voter turnout etc. ) Unifying the ward by the institution of a comprehensive website accessible by all the ward 's residents is a new , innovative potential means of accomplishing such alongside more tried and true methods of encouraging and fostering participation through regular open community consultation and the like .
#Text=Q : Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=A : To pay equity to all issues and too to bring a different kind of representation to this ward .
#Text=Q : Why do you want to represent this particular ward on council ?
#Text=A : To represent the multiplicity of its diversity , which differs from that of other wards .

#Text=Too , this ward has been my home for 20+ years and I have been actively involved within such throughout , as such I feel well suited to representing the people living and working within and further engaging with them to identify their needs , thoughts , wants etc. and seeking to foster positive interactions and growth within this , my home ward , in keeping and adhering to the diversity of the wards constituents .
#Text=Q : How are you currently involved in the community ?

#Text=A : As a leader and a participant within many community groups I currently spend and have spent much of the past two decades alongside the constituency working to address , react to and seek democratic solutions to the ward 's needs .

#Text=As a member of multiple local Boards , Committees , Executives and community groups , I strive to keep abreast of issues through continual personal interaction with the residents and too through multimedia sources .
